page.title: 07LANDSCAPE_YEW TREES.
page.content: The{Yew Forest}at{Kingley Vale}on the South Downs in Sussex is the finest in Europe. In the forest there are Ancient Groves containing trees at least 500 years old.The atmosphere in these groves is very eerie.The trees are very twisted and gnarled.According to legend a grove of Yew trees was planted to commemorate a battle against the{Vikings}in{A.D.859.}For many years Yew wood was important for making long bows. The Yew tree is evergreen.Female Yew trees bear red berries in the Autumn.Male Yew trees have tiny cones. The leaves,pips and bark of the Yew are poisonous to humans,cattle and horses.
